title: Exodus Chapter 22 Quiz - Multi-Level
description: An enhanced quiz on Exodus chapter 22 with Easy, Medium, Hard, and Theological levels. Each level has 15 carefully crafted questions. Choose your difficulty and dive in!

easy.title: Exodus Chapter 22 Quiz - Easy Level
easy.description: Perfect for beginners! Test your basic knowledge of Exodus Chapter 22.

questions.question: According to Exodus 22:1, how many oxen must a man restore if he steals and kills an ox?
questions.correctAnswer: Five oxen
questions.explanation: Exodus 22:1 states that if a man steals and kills an ox, he must restore five oxen for one ox.

questions.question: What does Exodus 22:2 say about a thief found breaking in who is killed?
options: No blood shall be shed for him
He must be punished by exile
questions.correctAnswer: No blood shall be shed for him
questions.explanation: Exodus 22:2 states that if a thief is found breaking in and is killed, there shall be no bloodshed for him.

questions.question: If the sun has risen on a thief who broke in, what does Exodus 22:3 say must happen to him?
options: Blood shall be shed for him
He shall be given a warning
questions.correctAnswer: Blood shall be shed for him
questions.explanation: According to Exodus 22:3, if the sun has risen on the thief, blood shall be shed for him because he should make full restitution.

questions.question: How much must a man restore if he is found with stolen ox, ass, or sheep alive, according to Exodus 22:4?
questions.correctAnswer: Double
questions.explanation: Exodus 22:4 states that if a man is found with stolen property alive, he shall restore double.

questions.question: What must a man do if his beast feeds in another man's field as per Exodus 22:5?
options: Make restitution of the best of his own field and vineyard
Pay a fine to the judges
questions.correctAnswer: Make restitution of the best of his own field and vineyard
questions.explanation: Exodus 22:5 says he shall make restitution of the best of his own field and vineyard.

questions.question: Who must make restitution if fire breaks out and consumes crops, according to Exodus 22:6?
options: The one who kindled the fire
questions.correctAnswer: The one who kindled the fire
questions.explanation: Exodus 22:6 states that he who kindled the fire must make restitution.

questions.question: What happens if a man delivers money or goods to his neighbor for safekeeping and it is stolen, according to Exodus 22:7?
options: The goods are replaced at market value
questions.correctAnswer: The thief must pay double
questions.explanation: Exodus 22:7 states that if the thief is found, he must pay double.

questions.question: What must the master of the house do if the thief is not found stealing from his house, as per Exodus 22:8?
questions.correctAnswer: Be brought before the judges
questions.explanation: Exodus 22:8 says the master shall be brought to the judges to see if he has put his hand to his neighbor's goods.

questions.question: According to Exodus 22:16, what must a man do if he entices a maid who is not betrothed and lies with her?
options: Endow her to be his wife
questions.correctAnswer: Endow her to be his wife
questions.explanation: Exodus 22:16 states that he shall surely endow her to be his wife.

questions.question: True or False: Exodus 22:18 commands to not suffer a witch to live.
questions.correctAnswer: True
questions.explanation: Exodus 22:18 clearly states, 'Thou shalt not suffer a witch to live.'

questions.question: True or False: Exodus 22:21 says you should oppress strangers because you were strangers in Egypt.
questions.correctAnswer: False
questions.explanation: Exodus 22:21 commands that you shall neither vex nor oppress a stranger, for you were strangers in Egypt.

questions.question: True or False: Exodus 22:31 states that you shall eat any flesh torn by beasts in the field.
questions.correctAnswer: False
questions.explanation: Exodus 22:31 commands not to eat any flesh torn by beasts and to cast it to the dogs.

questions.question: Complete the verse from Exodus 22:25: 'If thou lend money to any of my people that is poor by thee, thou shalt not be to him as an ______.'
questions.correctAnswer: usurer
questions.explanation: Exodus 22:25 commands not to act as an usurer when lending to the poor.

questions.question: What shall happen if someone sacrifices to a god other than the LORD, according to Exodus 22:20?
questions.correctAnswer: He shall be utterly destroyed
questions.explanation: Exodus 22:20 states that anyone who sacrifices to any god except the LORD shall be utterly destroyed.

questions.question: According to Exodus 22:26, what must be done if you take your neighbor's raiment as a pledge?
options: Deliver it to him by the sun going down
questions.correctAnswer: Deliver it to him by the sun going down
questions.explanation: Exodus 22:26 commands that raiment taken as pledge must be returned by sunset.

medium.title: Exodus Chapter 22 Quiz - Medium Level
medium.description: Ready for more? Apply biblical truths from Exodus Chapter 22 to real-life situations.

questions.question: A fellow believer is struggling with honesty and restitution after stealing from a neighbor. Based on Exodus 22, what biblical principle should you share about making restitution?
options: Restore five oxen for an ox and four sheep for a sheep
questions.correctAnswer: Restore five oxen for an ox and four sheep for a sheep
questions.explanation: Exodus 22:1 teaches that if a man steals an ox or sheep and kills or sells it, he must restore five oxen for an ox and four sheep for a sheep, emphasizing full restitution and honesty. Related verses include Exodus 22:4 and Exodus 22:7.

questions.question: How does Exodus 22 teach us about justice when dealing with a thief caught breaking in at night?
options: The thief should be forgiven immediately
Blood shall not be shed if the thief is caught at night and killed
The thief should be sold as a slave
The thief must pay double restitution
questions.correctAnswer: Blood shall not be shed if the thief is caught at night and killed
questions.explanation: Exodus 22:2 states that if a thief is found breaking in at night and is killed, there shall be no bloodguilt for his death, teaching mercy and justice in the context of protecting one's home. Exodus 22:3 contrasts this by requiring restitution if caught by day.

questions.question: A neighbor entrusts you with their ox. The ox dies while in your care, and no one saw what happened. What does Exodus 22 instruct about your responsibility?
options: No repayment is required if an oath is made
You must immediately replace the ox
You are not responsible at all
questions.correctAnswer: No repayment is required if an oath is made
questions.explanation: Exodus 22:10-11 explains that if an animal dies or is hurt without witnesses, an oath between the two parties is to be made, and the owner must accept it without requiring repayment, teaching integrity and trust.

questions.question: How does Exodus 22 guide us in dealing with those who are poor and need to borrow money?
options: Lend without charging interest or usury
questions.correctAnswer: Lend without charging interest or usury
questions.explanation: Exodus 22:25 instructs believers to lend money to the poor without acting as an usurer or charging interest, emphasizing generosity and compassion in stewardship. This is supported by verses 26-27 about returning a poor person's pledge promptly.

questions.question: What teaching about marriage and responsibility is found in Exodus 22 regarding a man who entices a virgin who is not betrothed?
options: He must marry her or pay a dowry if the father refuses
He can leave without any responsibility
He must pay a fine to the community
He should send her away immediately
questions.correctAnswer: He must marry her or pay a dowry if the father refuses
questions.explanation: Exodus 22:16-17 teaches that a man who entices a virgin must endow her to be his wife, but if her father refuses, he must pay a dowry, emphasizing responsibility, honor, and respect in relationships.

questions.question: A believer asks about God's attitude toward those who afflict widows or orphans. What does Exodus 22 say about this issue?
options: God will hear their cries and bring judgment
It is acceptable to afflict them
They should seek help from neighbors only
questions.correctAnswer: God will hear their cries and bring judgment
questions.explanation: Exodus 22:22-24 states that God hears the cries of widows and orphans and will bring judgment on those who afflict them, highlighting God's justice and care for the vulnerable.

questions.question: True or False: According to Exodus 22, if a man borrows his neighbor's animal and it is hurt or dies while the owner is with it, the borrower must make restitution.
questions.correctAnswer: False
questions.explanation: Exodus 22:15 teaches that if the owner is with the animal when it is hurt or dies, the borrower is not required to make restitution because it is considered part of the hire or agreement.

questions.question: What does Exodus 22 say about sacrifices made to gods other than the LORD?
options: They will be accepted by God
questions.correctAnswer: They shall be utterly destroyed
questions.explanation: Exodus 22:20 clearly states that anyone who sacrifices to gods other than the LORD shall be utterly destroyed, teaching the importance of exclusive worship of God.

questions.question: How does this chapter instruct believers to treat strangers living among them?
options: Treat them kindly and do not oppress them
questions.correctAnswer: Treat them kindly and do not oppress them
questions.explanation: Exodus 22:21 commands believers not to vex or oppress strangers, reminding them that they were once strangers in Egypt, teaching empathy and kindness.

questions.question: A believer is concerned about how to honor God with their offerings. What does Exodus 22 teach about bringing the first of the fruits and animals?
options: Offer the first fruits and firstborn animals promptly
Only give offerings once a year
questions.correctAnswer: Offer the first fruits and firstborn animals promptly
questions.explanation: Exodus 22:29-30 commands not to delay the offering of the first fruits and the firstborn of animals, teaching stewardship, gratitude, and honor toward God.

questions.question: According to Exodus 22, what should a person do if they take a neighbor's garment as a pledge for a loan?
options: Keep it until the debt is paid, no matter how long
Return it before sunset because it is their only covering
questions.correctAnswer: Return it before sunset because it is their only covering
questions.explanation: Exodus 22:26-27 instructs that if a garment is taken as a pledge, it must be returned by sunset since it is the only covering for the person's skin, emphasizing compassion and respect.

questions.question: True or False: Exodus 22 commands that anyone practicing witchcraft must be allowed to continue living among the people.
questions.correctAnswer: False
questions.explanation: Exodus 22:18 commands that a witch shall not be allowed to live, showing the seriousness of rejecting occult practices within the community.

questions.question: A brother wants to understand the importance of honesty in handling lost property. According to Exodus 22, what should be done when lost property is claimed by another?
options: The one who claims it must pay double if proven false
The judges decide and the condemned pays double restitution
questions.correctAnswer: The judges decide and the condemned pays double restitution
questions.explanation: Exodus 22:9 teaches that disputes over lost property must come before the judges, and the party condemned must pay double restitution, emphasizing justice and integrity.

questions.question: Fill in the blank: Exodus 22 teaches that you shall not ______ the gods, nor curse the ruler of your people.
questions.correctAnswer: Revile
questions.explanation: Exodus 22:28 commands not to revile the gods or curse rulers, teaching respect for authority and reverence.

questions.question: If a fire started by a person consumes a neighbor's crops, what does Exodus 22 say about the responsibility of the one who kindled the fire?
options: They should apologize but pay nothing
questions.correctAnswer: They must make full restitution
questions.explanation: Exodus 22:6 teaches that if a person's fire catches and consumes another's crops, they must make restitution, emphasizing accountability and integrity.

questions.question: How does Exodus 22 instruct believers to treat animals that have been torn by beasts in the field when borrowing them?
options: Bring the torn parts as evidence and not make restitution
questions.correctAnswer: Bring the torn parts as evidence and not make restitution
questions.explanation: Exodus 22:13 explains that if an animal is torn, the borrower should bring the torn parts as witness and is not required to make restitution, teaching fairness.

hard.title: Exodus Chapter 22 Quiz - Hard Level
hard.description: Challenge yourself with deep analysis and cross-biblical connections from Exodus Chapter 22.

questions.question: According to Exodus 22:1, how many oxen must a man restore if he steals and kills one ox?
questions.correctAnswer: Five oxen
questions.explanation: Exodus 22:1 states that if a man steals and kills an ox, he must restore five oxen for one ox, showing the principle of multiple restitution.

questions.question: Exodus 22:2 allows killing a thief found breaking in at night without blood guilt. What condition changes this ruling according to verse 3?
options: If the sun has risen on him
If the thief pleads for mercy
If the thief is a foreigner
questions.correctAnswer: If the sun has risen on him
questions.explanation: Verse 3 clarifies that if the sun has risen on the thief, there shall be bloodshed because full restitution should be made, reflecting the cultural context of night versus day protection.

questions.question: In Exodus 22:4, what is required if a man is found with stolen livestock alive in his possession?
questions.correctAnswer: Restore double
questions.explanation: The verse prescribes double restitution for stolen livestock found alive, emphasizing justice and deterrence in ancient Near Eastern law codes.

questions.question: Exodus 22:6 discusses fire causing damage to another's crops. What does this law reveal about responsibility in the ancient Hebrew context?
options: The one who kindled the fire must make restitution
The owner of the field must bear the loss
questions.correctAnswer: The one who kindled the fire must make restitution
questions.explanation: This law reflects the principle of personal responsibility for damage caused, consistent with other ancient Near Eastern laws, highlighting accountability.

questions.question: What principle regarding entrusted property is taught in Exodus 22:10-11 concerning an animal that dies or is hurt with no witnesses?
options: An oath between parties protects the keeper from restitution
The keeper must always pay full restitution
The animal must be replaced with two others
questions.correctAnswer: An oath between parties protects the keeper from restitution
questions.explanation: Verse 11 instructs an oath to confirm innocence, showing an early legal mechanism to resolve disputes fairly when evidence is lacking.

questions.question: Exodus 22:16-17 mandates a man who entices a virgin to do what if her father refuses to give her to him in marriage?
options: Pay money according to the dowry of virgins
questions.correctAnswer: Pay money according to the dowry of virgins
questions.explanation: This reflects the cultural importance of dowry and family consent in marriage negotiations in ancient Israelite society.

questions.question: Which of the following punishments is commanded in Exodus 22:18 for a witch?
options: She shall not be suffered to live
questions.correctAnswer: She shall not be suffered to live
questions.explanation: This harsh penalty reflects the ancient Israelite strict prohibition against witchcraft, emphasizing purity and covenant faithfulness.

questions.question: What is the consequence in Exodus 22:19 for a person who lies with a beast?
options: He shall be put to death
questions.correctAnswer: He shall be put to death
questions.explanation: This law demonstrates the severity of sexual prohibitions designed to maintain community holiness and order.

questions.question: Exodus 22:20 warns against sacrifices to gods other than the LORD. What is the stated consequence?
options: He shall be forgiven if he repents
He shall offer a double sacrifice
questions.correctAnswer: He shall be utterly destroyed
questions.explanation: This command enforces exclusive worship of YHWH, a central theme in Israelite covenant theology.

questions.question: According to Exodus 22:21, why must the Israelites not vex or oppress a stranger?
options: Because they were strangers in the land of Egypt
Because strangers are under God's special protection
Because strangers have no land rights
questions.correctAnswer: Because they were strangers in the land of Egypt
questions.explanation: This verse invokes Israel’s own history of exile and marginalization to promote empathy and social justice.

questions.question: Exodus 22:22-24 warn of God's wrath if widows or fatherless children are afflicted. What is a specific consequence mentioned?
options: Your wives shall be widows, and your children fatherless
You shall be struck with leprosy
questions.correctAnswer: Your wives shall be widows, and your children fatherless
questions.explanation: The dramatic consequence underscores the seriousness of social injustice toward vulnerable groups.

questions.question: What does Exodus 22:25 forbid when lending money to the poor among God's people?
questions.correctAnswer: Charging interest (usury)
questions.explanation: This law promotes compassion and economic fairness, reflecting concern for the needy in covenant society.

questions.question: Exodus 22:26-27 commands returning a pledged garment by sunset. What is the reason given for this urgency?
options: It is the person's only covering
It is holy to the LORD
It is a symbol of covenant
It is made of precious fabric
questions.correctAnswer: It is the person's only covering
questions.explanation: The garment’s role as covering for sleep highlights the law’s humanitarian concern for dignity and basic needs.

questions.question: True or False: Exodus 22:28 commands that one must not revile the gods or curse the ruler of the people.
questions.correctAnswer: True
questions.explanation: Verse 28 explicitly forbids reviling gods and rulers, reflecting the importance of respect for divine and civil authority.

questions.question: Exodus 22:29-30 instruct the Israelites to offer first fruits and firstborn to the LORD. What literary device is evident in the parallel mention of sons and animals?
questions.correctAnswer: Parallelism
questions.explanation: The balanced structure linking firstborn sons and animals demonstrates Hebrew parallelism emphasizing consecration.

theological.title: Exodus Chapter 22 Quiz - Theological Level
theological.description: Deep biblical theology from Exodus Chapter 22 that unites all believers. Explore foundational truths about God, creation, and humanity.

questions.question: According to Exodus 22, what is the required restitution if a man steals and kills an ox?
options: Restore five oxen for one ox
Restore three oxen for one ox
Restore two oxen for one ox
Restore one ox for one ox
questions.correctAnswer: Restore five oxen for one ox
questions.explanation: Exodus 22:1 commands that if a man steals and kills an ox, he must restore five oxen, reflecting the gravity of theft and loss of property. This principle of restitution aligns with biblical justice principles seen in Leviticus 6:1-7, Numbers 5:6-7, and reaffirms the seriousness of sin against a neighbor's property as taught in the New Testament (Ephesians 4:28).

questions.question: What does Exodus 22 say about a thief found breaking in at night who is killed?
options: No blood shall be shed for him
He shall be given a trial
questions.correctAnswer: No blood shall be shed for him
questions.explanation: Exodus 22:2 states that if a thief is found breaking in at night and is killed, no bloodguilt shall be incurred, emphasizing the right to protect one's property. This principle is echoed in the right to self-defense seen in Luke 22:36-38 and Proverbs 24:11-12, acknowledging human sinfulness and the justice in protecting life and property.

questions.question: If a thief is caught with stolen property alive, what does Exodus 22 require?
options: He shall be put to death
He shall be given a warning
questions.correctAnswer: He shall restore double
questions.explanation: Exodus 22:4 requires that if a thief is caught with stolen property alive, he must restore double, illustrating God's justice and mercy by requiring restitution rather than mere punishment. This principle also appears in Leviticus 6:4-5 and is consistent with New Testament teachings on restitution and repentance (Luke 19:8).

questions.question: According to Exodus 22, what must a man do if his fire causes damage to his neighbor's field?
options: He shall be exempt from liability
questions.correctAnswer: He shall surely make restitution
questions.explanation: Exodus 22:6 commands that one who kindles a fire causing damage must make restitution, highlighting the responsibility for consequences of one's actions. This principle of accountability is underscored in Proverbs 22:8, Luke 12:47-48, and Romans 13:4 concerning just compensation for harm caused.

questions.question: What is the penalty if a man entices a virgin who is not betrothed and lies with her?
options: He shall endow her to be his wife
He shall pay a fine only
He shall be put to death
questions.correctAnswer: He shall endow her to be his wife
questions.explanation: Exodus 22:16 requires that a man who entices a virgin not betrothed shall endow her to be his wife, reflecting the high value placed on sexual purity and responsibility. This upholds the sanctity of marriage and is consistent with principles found in Deuteronomy 22:28-29 and affirmed in the New Testament's teaching on marriage and chastity (Hebrews 13:4).

questions.question: How does Exodus 22 instruct the Israelites to treat strangers in their land?
options: Do not vex or oppress them
questions.correctAnswer: Do not vex or oppress them
questions.explanation: Exodus 22:21 commands not to vex or oppress a stranger because the Israelites were strangers in Egypt, teaching compassion and justice toward foreigners. This principle is echoed in Leviticus 19:33-34, Deuteronomy 10:19, and reiterated in New Testament teachings on love and hospitality (Hebrews 13:2).

questions.question: What does Exodus 22 say about lending money to the poor among God's people?
options: Do not be an usurer; do not charge interest
Charge high interest to discourage borrowing
questions.correctAnswer: Do not be an usurer; do not charge interest
questions.explanation: Exodus 22:25 commands not to act as an usurer toward the poor, forbidding interest to protect the vulnerable and promote mercy, consistent with Leviticus 25:35-37, Deuteronomy 23:19-20, and New Testament teachings on generosity (Luke 6:34-35).

questions.question: What must be done if a neighbor’s raiment is taken as a pledge, according to Exodus 22?
questions.correctAnswer: Return it by sunset
questions.explanation: Exodus 22:26 demands that a pledged garment, which is the debtor’s covering, be returned before sunset to protect the dignity and well-being of the poor. This principle demonstrates God's concern for human needs and is reflected in Deuteronomy 24:12-13 and the compassionate justice taught in Isaiah 58:6-7.

questions.question: What instruction does Exodus 22 give regarding offering the first fruits and firstborn?
options: Do not delay offering them to the LORD
questions.correctAnswer: Do not delay offering them to the LORD
questions.explanation: Exodus 22:29 commands not to delay offering the first of ripe fruits and the firstborn of sons to God, signifying total devotion and acknowledgment of God's provision. This is consistent with Leviticus 23:10, Numbers 18:15, and the New Testament’s call for wholehearted worship (Romans 12:1).

questions.question: What is the divine consequence described in Exodus 22 for afflicting widows or orphans?
options: God hears their cry and punishes the afflictor
questions.correctAnswer: God hears their cry and punishes the afflictor
questions.explanation: Exodus 22:22-24 reveals God's protective justice toward widows and orphans, promising to hear their cry and execute judgment on those who afflict them. This principle is echoed in Deuteronomy 10:18, Psalm 146:9, and James 1:27, emphasizing God's care for the vulnerable.

questions.question: What does Exodus 22 say about sacrificing to gods other than the LORD?
options: The person shall be utterly destroyed
It is acceptable if done in secret
questions.correctAnswer: The person shall be utterly destroyed
questions.explanation: Exodus 22:20 declares that sacrificing to any god other than the LORD results in utter destruction, affirming the exclusive worship of Yahweh and emphasizing God's holiness and justice. This monotheistic demand is consistent with Deuteronomy 6:14-15, Isaiah 42:8, and the New Testament’s affirmation of Christ as the only mediator (1 Timothy 2:5).

questions.question: What does Exodus 22 teach about eating meat torn by beasts in the field?
options: Do not eat it; throw it to the dogs
questions.correctAnswer: Do not eat it; throw it to the dogs
questions.explanation: Exodus 22:31 instructs not to eat flesh torn by beasts but to cast it to the dogs, symbolizing purity and holiness in diet, reflecting God's call to be holy as He is holy (Leviticus 17:15-16, Deuteronomy 14:21). This aligns with New Testament teaching on food sanctification (Mark 7:18-19) emphasizing spiritual holiness.

questions.question: What happens if a man borrows something and it is hurt or dies while the owner is with it?
options: He shall not make it good
He shall be put to death
questions.correctAnswer: He shall not make it good
questions.explanation: Exodus 22:15 states that if the owner is present when the borrowed item is hurt or dies, the borrower is not liable, since the owner assumes risk. This principle reflects fairness and accountability, consistent with Deuteronomy 22:14 and the New Testament principle of bearing one another's burdens (Galatians 6:2).

questions.question: What is the prescribed punishment for lying with an animal in Exodus 22?
options: The person shall be put to death
questions.correctAnswer: The person shall be put to death
questions.explanation: Exodus 22:19 mandates death for bestiality, underscoring the sanctity of human sexuality and God's holiness. This severe judgment reflects God's intolerance of sexual sin, found also in Leviticus 20:15-16 and affirmed in Romans 1:26-27 regarding dishonoring God's design for human sexuality.

questions.question: According to Exodus 22, what must be done for the firstborn of oxen and sheep?
options: It shall be with its dam for seven days; on the eighth day it shall be given to the LORD
It shall be sold for profit
It shall be kept as a pet
questions.correctAnswer: It shall be with its dam for seven days; on the eighth day it shall be given to the LORD
questions.explanation: Exodus 22:30 instructs that the firstborn of oxen and sheep remain with the mother seven days and be given to God on the eighth day, symbolizing consecration and acknowledgement of God's sovereignty. This is consistent with Exodus 13:12 and Leviticus 27:26, highlighting God's claim over the firstborn and His provision.
